page.title: 01NORTH-EAST CHELTENHAM
page.content: THE BLOCK CONTAINS THREE MAIN AREAS. THE VILLAGE OF{PRESTBURY}LIES IN THE NORTH-WEST OF THE BLOCK; THE FOOTHILLS AND TOP OF THE{COTSWOLD HILL {ESCARPMENT}RUN FROM NORTH TO SOUTH ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE BLOCK, AND IN THE SOUTH-WEST SECTION ARE THE RESIDENTIAL AREAS OF{LYNWORTH}AND {WHADDON. PRESTBURY IS AN ATTRACTIVE VILLAGE WITH A NUMBER OF HISTORIC BUILDINGS. THERE IS AN INCREASING AMOUNT OF RESIDENTIAL DEVELOPMENT ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF THE VILLAGE. THE VILLAGE IS REASONABLY SELF-CONTAINED. THE WHADDON HOUSING ESTATE WAS BUILT BETWEEN THE WARS AND THE LYNWORTH ESTATE WAS BUILT DURING THE 1950s. THE COTSWOLD HILLS ARE AN ATTRACTIVE AREA OF OPEN GRASSLAND AND MIXED FARMING, AND ATTRACT TOURISTS FROM A WIDE AREA.
